{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3230888,"name":"Ardiano Works","username":"MSU2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/msu2000/{size}/190139_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-10T03:49:30.123Z","cooked":"

My Allen Bradley signal light didn’t come with 2 pin connector. What is the spec for this 2 pin connector and where do you get it from?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-09-10T03:49:30.123Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":324,"reads":236,"readers_count":235,"score":1667.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":440734,"topic_slug":"roborio-rsl-2-pin-connector","display_username":"Ardiano Works","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57747,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/roborio-rsl-2-pin-connector/440734/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3230889,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-10T03:52:48.075Z","cooked":"

It’s a standard 0.1" pitch connector, as are nearly all of the Rio connectors. Common mating connectors are 3-wire servo cables (commonly called “PWM” cables in FRC). Just search for “servo extension cable” on Amazon or other sites.

Alternatively: 2-pin Female to Female Cable - AndyMark, Inc

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-09-10T04:03:19.696Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":220,"readers_count":219,"score":119.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":440734,"topic_slug":"roborio-rsl-2-pin-connector","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.andymark.com/products/cable-2-pin-24-in","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"2-pin Female to Female Cable - AndyMark, Inc","clicks":101}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/roborio-rsl-2-pin-connector/440734/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3230899,"name":"Ken Pontbriant","username":"electroken","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/electroken/{size}/160387_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-10T11:09:10.783Z","cooked":"

There are several 0.1" pitch connector families that work with the roborio headers. Our choice for the RSL connector is Molex 15-57-9002 for the connector housing and 16-02-1114 for the contacts. That particular contact has a much higher mating and retention force than is common for 0.1" pitch connectors.

The “official” Molex crimper for that contact is over $300. We have chosen to use IWS-3220M from Amazon that set us back $26 instead. The same crimper works for the JST connectors that Rev likes to use.

image1006×118 19.6 KB

https://experience.molex.com/solutions/first-robotics/

Or, cut one end off of a PWM cable…
